title: A Primal-dual Approach for Solving Variational Inequalities with General-form Constraints. (arXiv:2210.15659v3 [stat.ML] UPDATED)
abstract: Yang et al. (2023) recently addressed the open problem of solving Variational Inequalities (VIs) with equality and inequality constraints through a first-order gradient method. However, the proposed primal-dual method called ACVI is applicable when we can compute analytic solutions of its subproblems; thus, the general case remains an open problem. In this paper, we adopt a warm-starting technique where we solve the subproblems approximately at each iteration and initialize the variables with the approximate solution found at the previous iteration. We prove its convergence and show that the gap function of the last iterate of this inexact-ACVI method decreases at a rate of $\mathcal{O}(\frac{1}{\sqrt{K}})$ when the operator is $L$-Lipschitz and monotone, provided that the errors decrease at appropriate rates. tldr: 本文介绍了一种解决具有一般形式约束的变分不等式的原始-对偶方法，并使用一种温启动技术，在每次迭代中近似地解决子问题，我们证明了它的收敛性，并展示了它的收敛速度比其精确对应物更快。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a primal-dual method for solving variational inequalities with general-form constraints, where a warm-starting technique is adopted to solve the subproblems approximately at each iteration. Its convergence is proved and it is shown that this inexact-ACVI method converges faster than its exact counterpart in numerical experiments.
